title: FULL_CAFFE2=1 usage
body_html:
I tried building caffe2 and pytorch using FULL_CAFFE2=1 setup.py install . I was then able to execute the caffe2 MNIST sample at https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials/blob/master/MNIST.ipynb.

However, I observed all caffe2 binaries/tests are not built while using FULL_CAFFE2. I am just curious to know if it would be possible to build CPP binaries and tests too using this option in future. Please let me know if that is intended.
body_text:
I tried building caffe2 and pytorch using FULL_CAFFE2=1 setup.py install . I was then able to execute the caffe2 MNIST sample at https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials/blob/master/MNIST.ipynb.
However, I observed all caffe2 binaries/tests are not built while using FULL_CAFFE2. I am just curious to know if it would be possible to build CPP binaries and tests too using this option in future. Please let me know if that is intended.
body:
I tried building caffe2 and pytorch using `FULL_CAFFE2=1 setup.py install` . I was then able to execute the caffe2 MNIST sample at https://github.com/caffe2/tutorials/blob/master/MNIST.ipynb. 

However, I observed all caffe2 binaries/tests are not built while using FULL_CAFFE2. I am just curious to know if it would be possible to build CPP binaries and tests too using this option in future. Please let me know if that is intended.
